javax.jaxtx.model.jta.opt
Interface TransactionManager

public interface TransactionManager

This is the interface that application servers/web services will use to communicate with the underlying transaction system. It provides access to all of the routines that a client will use (e.g., begin and end), and also gives access to the Transaction class which allows services to enlist/delist participants.

Method Summary
 Transaction getTransaction()
          Return the transaction associated with the invoking thread.
 void resume(Transaction which)
          Resume the specified transaction with the invoking thread, i.e., change the thread's notion of the current transaction to the one provided.
 Transaction suspend()
          Suspend the current transaction, i.e., the one associated with the invoking thread.

the transaction, or null if no transaction is associated.

resume

public void resume(Transaction which)
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   WrongStateException,
                   SystemException
Resume the specified transaction with the invoking thread, i.e., change the thread's notion of the current transaction to the one provided.
Parameters:
Transaction - the transaction to associate.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the target transaction is invalid.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current thread is already associated with a transaction.
SystemException - Thrown if an error occurs.
See Also:
Transaction
